definition: to receive in no small measure
deep/depth/deeply/(of a color) dark/deep/rich
old variant of 深[shen1]
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: And the quality yet inexpensive consumer goods from China have been warmly received by the local people here.
sentences.chinese: 中国物美价廉的日用消费品，也深受当地人民的欢迎。

sentences.english: The new teacher really rates with the director of our department.
sentences.chinese: 这位新来的教师深受我系系主任的好评。

sentences.english: You know, as a result we suffered from it.
sentences.chinese: 结果就是，我们都深受其害。

sentences.english: As Fan ChunRen's disciple, he was influenced deeply.
sentences.chinese: 作为范纯仁的弟子，又深受其影响。

sentences.english: Kookaburra " is a well-loved children ' s song from Australia."
sentences.chinese: “翠鸟”是一首澳大利亚歌曲，深受孩子们的喜爱。

sentences.english: Intercity bus travel has taken off in the last few years.
sentences.chinese: 长途客车旅行在最近的几年里深受欢迎。

sentences.english: Vaudeville was very popular in the United States during the early nineteen hundreds.
sentences.chinese: 在二十世纪初期，歌舞杂耍在美国城乡深受欢迎。

sentences.english: He was deeply revered for his ability and sagacity in military affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他在军事上的才略深受大家敬仰。

sentences.english: It is greatly welcomed with a mass of enterprises and has built up a good company credit standing within and outside food industry.
sentences.chinese: 深受广大企业的青睐，在业内外享有良好的企业信誉。

sentences.english: And as for 15 years, rice at permanent residents, the acclaimed by the mayor.
sentences.chinese: 又担任拉赖因堡15年常任市长，深受市民的拥戴。

sentences.english: The pop song My heart will go on has really taken the public's fancy.
sentences.chinese: 这首流行歌曲《我心依旧》深受大众喜爱。

sentences.english: Pine mushroom is a local delicacy in Hunan province of China.
sentences.chinese: 湖南的松菌是深受当地群众欢迎的一种野生食用菌。

sentences.english: The Egyptian poor are deeply imbued with teachings of Islam.
sentences.chinese: 埃及贫民深受伊斯兰教教义的影响。

sentences.english: Since building up the country, Ming Dynasty had always suffered the Japanese pirates' invading and harassing.
sentences.chinese: 从建国开始，明朝一直深受倭寇的侵扰。

sentences.english: Jieyou lived in Wusun for more than 50 years and enjoyed the love and respect of the Wusun people.
sentences.chinese: 她在乌孙国生活了五十多年，深受乌孙人民的爱戴。

sentences.english: In addition to climbing, the area is popular with hillwalkers and those interested in natural history.
sentences.chinese: 除攀岩外，这里也深受走山族和自然史爱好者的喜爱。

definition: to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
to fully experience (good or bad)
to receive (praise, an education, punishment etc)/to be ...ed (praised, educated, punished etc)
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
to love and respect/love and respect
to chase after (a popular person or item)/to pursue/popularity
favorable criticism/positive evaluation
to esteem/to think highly of/to accord importance to/to revere
to treasure/to be very fond of
favorite
numerous

to be well acquainted with
popular/well-received
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
